remarks: If ` A ( x ) , C ( x ) ` are differentiable functions and ` A `` <_ C `` ` , then for ` x <_ y ` , ` A ( y ) - A ( x ) <_ C ( y ) - C ( x ) ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-May-2016.)
statement:
dvle.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. RR ) $.
dvle.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. RR ) $.
dvle.a $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( M [,] N ) |-> A ) e. ( ( M [,] N ) -cn-> RR ) ) $.
dvle.b $e |- ( ph -> ( RR _D ( x e. ( M (,) N ) |-> A ) ) = ( x e. ( M (,) N ) |-> B ) ) $.
dvle.c $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( M [,] N ) |-> C ) e. ( ( M [,] N ) -cn-> RR ) ) $.
dvle.d $e |- ( ph -> ( RR _D ( x e. ( M (,) N ) |-> C ) ) = ( x e. ( M (,) N ) |-> D ) ) $.
dvle.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( M (,) N ) ) -> B <_ D ) $.
dvle.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( M [,] N ) ) $.
dvle.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( M [,] N ) ) $.
dvle.l $e |- ( ph -> X <_ Y ) $.
dvle.p $e |- ( x = X -> A = P ) $.
dvle.q $e |- ( x = X -> C = Q ) $.
dvle.r $e |- ( x = Y -> A = R ) $.
dvle.s $e |- ( x = Y -> C = S ) $.
dvle $p |- ( ph -> ( R - P ) <_ ( S - Q ) ) $.
$d M x $.
$d N x $.
